column4: is there a way to get the wireless drivers on my computer without an ethernet connection, but another computer and a USB stick?
it looks like you're on the internet already
are you referring to using ndiswrapper for a windows driver?
I have no idea about a macbook
here is an article that may give some direction at least.  Like which packages to put on your usb. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1935799
that looks promising, leave it on your screan and unplug your current ethernet and plug it into the macbook and follow the steps
it looks like you need to download the b43-fwcutter packaga and the broadcom firmware to your usb
okay so what's the question again?  Sounds like you have it handled.
not sure about msdos though, wasn't that fat16 hehe
it doesn't work until you can ping
